Reviews.Title: Kodak is making great cameras again
Reviews.Author: Loren
Reviews.Content: When I wanted a new camera, my first thought was one of the Japanese trinity: Canon, Nikon or Sony. I first got into Kodak almost by accident: we went on a trip and left our camera at home so I bought a V603 P&S; on sale at Walmart. Loved it immediately! Crisp, bright pictures and several extras, like panorama shots and "perfect touch" one click editing that I found indispensable after awhile.So when I wanted a bigger camera, I started looking at Kodak. I first saw the Kodak Z812IS, but when I saw the Z1012, I went for it. I've not been disappointed. I know that Kodak has made some dogs in the past few years, but I think you'll find this an excellent camera, and you'll like it even better if you're taking price into consideration.Like others here have said, I ding it on battery life. You absolutely must get the charger and at least three rechargeable lithium batteries. Don't be confused when it says there's a lithium battery included in the kit: that's a one-use lithium, not a rechargeable.Two more things about batteries: #1. The klic-8000 battery is the shape of two AA's. You can't use alkalines - they dip below peak current too quickly - but you can use the regular lithium AA's that you see in stores. It's an expensive way to go compared to rechargeables, but it works in a pinch. #2. Don't buy Kodak brand klic-8000's. There are some good aftermarket li-ions of the same size that are considerable cheaper and work just as well.As for performance, you'll be pleased. The "smart" mode (S on the dial) works reasonably well, but it takes away all your options except suppressing the flash. Interestingly, smart mode applies the "perfect touch" editing automatically, and it usually results in a good picture. I often use it.Mostly, though I switch to the "P" setting, which is a programmed setting with just a few more options, like lighter or darker. Honestly, for most of us, the shutter priority and aperture priority, much less the manual setup, will hardly ever be needed. If you're such a good photographer than you need them frequently, you're probably beyond a camera like this and already have a SLR. They're a selling point, though, and you can hardly imagine a $200+ camera that would dare to leave those features out.You might be tempted by the 18X lenses on a few other brands in this camera configuration, but I think you'll be surprised at how much you get out of a 12X lens. Also, unlike all the digital cameras I've ever had, the digital zoom actually works very well. Obviously you get fewer pixels, but what you get is remarkably sharp, and you need make no apologies. That's probably why they call it "advanced digital zoom".This model makes panoramas easy, and there's a big advantage to doing them in the camera: it locks the same settings for the whole panorama, so there's no line between frames as there is when you take three separate pictures and stitch them. The stitching "engine" is amazingly good.And yes, there is HD video, and it looks pretty nice, but don't expect it to replace your video camera. For one thing, sound isn't that great, but what can you expect from tiny microphones behind tiny holes in the camera face? Really, this is a case of not how well the bear dances, but that it can dance at all. And yes, you can zoom while filming.You've probably figured out by now, with these cameras, that there's really not as much flexibility as all the controls and options would make you think there is. To the point: low light pictures will make poor, grainy pictures, with anything short of a tripod, no matter how you set the camera. If you want more capacity in low light, get a high-end SLR.Finally, if you're used to a pocket camera, having this larger thing around your neck will take some getting used to. This camera isn't huge, but it is too big for your shirt pocket. I wish they'd make a small camera with this much lens, but we're not quite there yet - though the (expensive) Canon PowerShot G9 has some wonderful features that make it almost worth giving up some lens power for.ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:After using this about 4-5 months, I know a lot more about it than I did at first.My pictures have been, overall, outstanding, on low ISO speeds. Not sure you'll get better anywhere. One thing I've learned is that the pictures are a lot better than they look on the camera. I think Kodak decided to save 50¢ by putting in a lower quality LCD, that really doesn't give you good feedback on picture quality. In fact, the LCD on my old V603 was far better.There are occasional odd freeze-ups that I've had with this camera. It has never stopped working, but I have had to remove the battery once or twice. I also noticed recently that when I use an 8GB card, rendering pictures got really slow, like it had a lot of processing to do. Not sure what that's all about.My biggest annoyance remains the bulk of the camera, after being used to a pocketable camera. I'm looking for a smaller camera to add to the camera bag, such as the Panasonic Lumix DMC-TZ5K 9MP as a pocketable (though not small) camera--I used a friend's and was very impressed. For a very small camera, J.D. Powers has rated the Sony Cybershot T series (such as this Sony Cybershot DSC-T500 10.1MP) very high, though I've not tried it.

Reviews.Title: Almost a 5-star camera
Reviews.Author: KoiKeeper "KoiKeeper"
Reviews.Content: Kodak is back on track.This is a real bargain if it holds up for a few years.The Kodak Easyshare Z1012-IS works very well and reliably in normal light.  No auto focus is perfect and this camera is not an exception to that rule.The HD Quick-time movie options work very well. You need 3rd party software to convert Apple Quick-time movies to Windows formats.Extreme Zoom is clear (when it focuses right), but it is a tad less predictable than the regular lens settings. Internal panorama stitching works surprisingly well.Battery life is fair to good (50 to 100 shots per charge).It is easy to figure out most settings and menus.  And it is good that most controls are simple and intuitive as the awful part of this package is the documentation; it is almost nonexistent.If you search the Kodak support site diligently; the in-depth instruction manual can be discovered, but it is not included with the camera, nor is it downloadable.  Its format is FLASH not PDF; (it ought to be on the CD with the Easyshare software).This is a small, light yet powerful and flexible camera, I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: great point and shoot with high zoom
Reviews.Author: J. A. Jordan "maine doc"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera shortly after receiving panasonic 10MP lumix w 12x zoom.  I found out the lumix was as big as my sony digital slr, so I didnt see the point in bringing this on vacation with me.  I also wanted a camera that focused better than the lumix in low light conditions, and this camera does.  I am not totally unbiased, as I had owned 3 other kodak easyshares prior to this, and was happy with their quality, so I bought this kodak the day before traveling to yosemite, napa and san francisco.  I wanted a smaller point and shoot with high zoom for this trip.  I do also own the sony alpha 700 digital slr, but, again it is bulky for traveling, especially with camcorder in the carryon.  The kodak took very good quality pictures and the panoramic function worked very well, joining the images together seamlessly.  It does step the image quality down slightly to use panoramic function, but I was able to stitch my own panoramic using home software with full quality images.  I will be posting some of these images from yosemite and san francisco once I reduce the image sizes.  I would buy this camera again for certain.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use and great photos
Reviews.Author: Dave from Western NY
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for better photo quality since I do a lot of close up and macro shots.  I am only just getting into the features of this camera but at a recent family event the wide angle and the panoramic shots were really handy.  The panoramic shots are amazing the way the camera stitches the separate shots together.  I really like the camera.

Reviews.Title: Being Fair
Reviews.Author: A New Mommy
Reviews.Content: To be fair to this camera, it is good and bad.  It depends on what you're looking for in your camera.I bought this camera in August 2008 and now it's on eBay.  I upgraded from a Kodak C series point and shoot digital and thought this was the logical next step for upgrading to an SLR format.  I also really like the EasyShare software.I was very disappointed with the camera.First of all, do not be decieved by how large this camera looks in the photograph on ANY website.  It is very small and light weight.  Which can go one of two ways depending on what you're looking for.There is no fun clicking sound after you take a shot, no shutter closure, the camera makes more of a hissing sound.  That can take the fun out of taking photos for some people.The lens has a wonderful zoom of 12x optical, but the lens is slow to respond to zoom commands.  The camera is slow overall and often did not turn on quickly when I went to use it.  I had to turn it on and off several times before it was ready to go.The burst mode is horrible, it lags when shooting anything and it freezes up often.  Which is bad news for people shooting children in motion.  Or any wildlife shots.  Even in the special function modes, like sport, etc, it lags and the photos come out blurry.  It's speed performance leaves a lot to be desired and I ended up shooting in automatic mode more often then I wanted to b/c I knew I would miss critical shots if I changed the settings.I used the fireworks setting for shooting fireworks at Walt Disney World and all of the photos ended up blurry.  I was stood as still as I could while the shot was being processed and none of them were usable.  Once I switched to shutter priority and set the shutter speed very low, I was able to capture some nice shots.  So the fireworks setting was useless.10.1 megapixels does not a good camera make.  It's nice to have if you're blowing up shots to the size of a billboard, but otherwise, if you're getting sucked in by the high MP, look elsewhere.  It's just not that important in a camera this small.The f number has a surprisingly high setting at 2.8.  I was able to shoot in apeture priority quite a bit and get some very beautiful macro photos.  The borkeh was beautiful and the depth of field was lovely.  The photos I am most proud of that I took with this camera are the ones shot in apeture priority.Every shot I took in Program mode came back blurry.  Even professional photographers that I know who used P mode couldn't quite get it.  So back to the auto setting.Manual mode was a waste since this zoom lens is too hard to control for manual shots.  It's fine for manual macro shots, but, otherwise, another miss.The Shutter Priority mode is just ok.  Since the camera is really slow overall, it's not much of an improvement to change the shutter priority to anything fast, since it's never really fast at all.  The click to capture best in class award must be a joke.  Seriously, there is no speed with this camera.The flash always fires, even when I had the flash turned off and wanted to shoot in natural light.  That was impossible to overcome.The camera does not come with a battery.  You can expect to purchase an alkaline battery and the recharger separetely.  So the camera does not work out of the box.  You can use regular AA batteries, but they will be drained within a day.  You also have to purchase extra memory cards.  The camera held maybe 20 pictures without the memory card.If you're not into using the viewfinder, then you're in luck since this camera comes equiped with the option to use either the viewfinder or the monitor for picture-taking.The battery life seemed to be fine.  I used it all day on several vacations and trips and even when the battery started to get low, I would turn off the camera and that gave the battery a boost.  It charges up quickly which is a nice turnaround feature.  The small size of the camera is nice for traveling with and easy for carrying around.  It can be mounted to a tripod, if you so desire.The worst part about this camera is the speed of it is just totally lacking.  The additional modes to use are pretty worthless, but it's is nice to have advanced settings (PASM) to experiement with.  You're better off with a regular point and shoot if you're not into creative photography.  If you're into exploring photos and taking more creative shots and learning more, then this camera is a SKIP.  Do not waste your money or time on it.  Go for something like the Canon Rebel XSi or the Nikon 40D.  Spend a couple of hundred dollars more to get exactly what you want (or save money and just stick with a point and shoot.)I just upgraded to the Canon 40D and skipped over all the step-up cameras and went for the one I knew I'd end up.The class this camera belongs to is confusing...it's not a point and shoot and it's not a true SLR...Last point - HD video.  I took HD video of my 3 year old trick or treating with my niece.  It would have been a nice keepsake, but when I played the video back, it was extremely choppy.  It wasn't even watchable since it cut in and out from start to finish.  That feature was disappointing to say the least.  I planned to send it off to my brother who lives some distance from me, but since it wasn't watchable and we couldnt' even tell what was going on, I never did send it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Love New Orleans
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera.  It really meets an important need in that niche between big, bulky DSLR cameras and small, handy "point and shoot" cameras.  It's reasonably small (it would easily fit in a large coat pocket), light, and very comfortable to operate.  I find the controls easy to locate and operate.It has tons of great program modes.  I have had my camera for a little over a month and haven't had the chance (or need) to play with some of the program modes.  But the ones I have played with have worked exactly as described and have taken outstanding exposures.  I especially love the "manner/museum" program that allows for almost silent photography.The manual settings are a really nice touch too for those special occasions that call for a little more control, though you could easily get by without ever using those settings if you didn't feel the need.  With all the program modes available, most situations are easily covered.The zoom is great, and the pause between shots if very short.  The picture quality is excellent.  I don't think I could have made a better choice.My only advice is to download the extended user manual from the Kodak web site to learn all the features available on this great camera.And the experience buying from Amazon.com was flawless.  I have never been a big proponent of on-line shopping, but this whole experience was so smooth and fast that I have put in two additional orders from them in the past month.  Absolutely no complaints, and lot of praise, for Amazon's service.

Reviews.Title: Lots of fun, great for amature photographers!
Reviews.Author: C. Bernard
Reviews.Content: I've had alot of fun with this camera so far taking pictures of everything from the kids to the lake. It has so many features to try out and the zoom is great! I shopped for a long time before purchasing so that I could find a camera that I would not grow out of. This is a great purchase for amature photographers like myself.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare Z1012 IS -A WONDERFUL CAMERA
Reviews.Author: kiteflyervt "kiteflyervt"
Reviews.Content: A great camera to use from everyday pictures to doing serious landscape photography. Love the crispness of the lens. The lens produces excellent true to life colors with virtually no distortion or chromatic aberration. A very easy menu on the camera to navigate and use. You can't go wrong purchasing this camera and you will be glad you did. I now reach for this baby more often than not instead of my DSLR Olympus Evolt 330 in many photo situations except when I do bird photography ,then I use the DSLR. The camera produces razor sharp images,true to life colors,easy to use ,the image stabilization works beautifully and is a joy to use.The right choice for doing serious photography without lugging around a DSLR or maybe the Budget does'nt allow a DSLR system right now.Just a beautiful camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera but accessory completion annoying
Reviews.Author: Anncamas
Reviews.Content: I love this new camera because of the lens quality, 12x zoom optical image stabilization feature, and price. I have tried other 8x and 10x zoom cameras the past few years in stores but always had trouble getting sharp point and shoot pictures even with image stabilization. This one works great, it's easy to hook up straight to my computer with the USB cord, and is a reasonable size for all the features.However, it's annoying to have to order a rechargeable battery (and charger since I am not getting the docking station) and hunt down a form fitting case since Kodak does not offer one. The way it's designed, it's needed in order to protect the display monitor (if I just want to toss in a bag - not a big camera case). Especially since the lens cap tends to pop off, as other reviewers have mentioned. I would rather have paid $25 or $30 more, with both included. A couple of years ago, I came back to Kodak after being away for over 15 years. I purchased the pocket sized V570 which has a wide-angle 5X optical zoom range. I found I used it much more then my Fuji FinePix SLR, with extra wide angle lens, because it was too cumbersome. While the Z1012 is smaller then the Fuji, there are still times when I will use the V570 because it's more compact. Now if Kodak can just improve the easy share software : )

Reviews.Title: Great Camara!
Reviews.Author: hayjam
Reviews.Content: So far this camera is great!  It is taking awesome pictures.  My favorite thing is the shutter speed.  You can actually get the action while it is happening, instead of right after.  As long as it lasts it will be a great buy!

Reviews.Title: Kodak 1012IS BEST CAMERA for both PICS and VIDEO (HIGH DEFINITION) WOW!!!
Reviews.Author: A. Estrada "John 3:16 For God So loved the Wo...
Reviews.Content: I am truly amazed at what I got for the money. This camera, the Kodak 1012IS has made me a new loyal Kodak customer from now on. I love this camera so much, that I had to take the time to review it here because I know that reading the reviews is what had a huge part of my decision to purchase along with the affordable price.When compared to the Canon SX or S5, this camera wins Hands Down! First of all, I was originally going to purchase the S5, then the SX came along online, but the price of those products scared my wallet big time. During this tough times people are being extremely careful where their money goes, and to my family that is the norm now.Having said that, I stumbled into this amazing product here on Amazon.com.I was researching prices for the S5, when I saw the Kodak 1012IS.. Right away the firt thing that caught my eye was the ability to record HD yes, HIGH DEFINITION Videos in full 720P resolution! Truly amazing. Not only has our current video VHS-C camera just recently died, our canon digital camera did too, so now we had a tough choice, buy a digital camera or a camcorder. I truly wanted both. Behold the, 1012IS!This camera single handedly has satisfied both my video and picture taking needs. Just last night it arrived at home and right away, out of the box, inserted my recently purchased Transcend 8 GIG Class 6 SDHC card, which I bought here, sold by Beach Camera,oh Boy, was I so pleasantly surprised. The card was recognized immediately, Over 2500 pics availble, how awesome is that. I then proceeded to the Video mode and WOW! I could record HD video to my hearts delight. Truly AMAZING. You know what was so amazing was the ability for the Kodak 1012IS to focus so easily in a very dark room. Specially in video mode, I was so amazed at that ability. And, what was also cool was that if I lost focus for some reason, all I had to do is ZOOM a bit and it refocused again specially after I panned left or right. I was speechless.So remember, You are ABLE to ZOOM while Recording High Definition or standard definition Video. This is simply amazing. It records the Audio in STEREO and it is good enough to understand the kids voices, hear the birds chirp, and all that is going around you in stereo. Its not a recording studio, but it gets the job done nicely.But the VIDEO, it is pure joy to see it, even on the onboard screen as you play it back. Your jaw will definitely drop.Once you transfer the videos and Pics to the PC you will be equally amazed. I recommend that you visit the Kodak Talk Forum at Steves Digital reviews website:[...]I learned so much from there. Also, there is a neat little program that changes your .MOV video files to .AVI so they play smoother on your PC. I forgot the name but it may be: MP4cam2AVI... or something like that. It sure makes a huge difference, and with that, you can use the AVI files to burn the video to DVD.  I use a program called DVD Author 3 and the videos look simply amazing. I know I may sound to over the top, but folks, believe me, I really love this new camera. It focuses so fast, processes so fast, and weights near nothing. It is so confortable in your hands, my wife loved that. Another surprise was how small it was. In pics it looks bigger, but its actually smaller then a regular music CD.Oh, the screen is so clear and it just feels like it should cost more. Kodak, please don't read this. :-)I hope this honest and sincere review helps you decide. I am so happy I now have a Video camera and Picture cameara. All in ONE. And for a price that we can now go to hometown buffett with the family to give thanks to God for great companies like these that have such great prices in times like these where every penny counts.Go ahead, buy it. You will be blessed like I am.Sincerely.Here is the list of all the things I purchased along with my camera. Links provided for you to check out, like I did.Card Reader with FREE 4GB SD card purchased from Thememstore:KingMax 4GB High-Speed Class 6 SDHC Card. Includes a FREE SDHC/SD/MMC USB Card reader which allows you to download your images, music and data directly to your computers USB port. Includes KingMax's LIFETIME WARRANTY....Transcend SD card purchased from Beach Camera:Transcend TS8GSDHC6 8GB SDHC card (SD 2.0 SPD Class 6)Kodak 1012IS, purchased from Electronica DirectKodak EasyShare Z1012 10.1MP Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized ZoomNextop Batteries and Charger:Nextop-2 Packs Kodak KLIC-8000 Brand New 1800mAh REPLACEMENT Battery + 1 Compatible Wall & Car Charger (FREE European Adaptor) for Kodak EasyShare Z612, Kodak EasyShare Z712 IS, EasyShare Z812 IS, EasyShare Z1012 IS, EasyShare Z1085 IS, EasyShare Z8612 IS

Reviews.Title: Kodak does not stand behind their products this is a piece of Junk/freezes up
Reviews.Author: lot4my$
Reviews.Content: owned for 13 months, was x-mas gift only used for 9 months.  Had Kodak supposedly repair it twice for freezing up and they didn't fix, now 1 month passed warranty they won't stand behind their product, kodak supervisor said it's not his problem.  I highly recommend you look at other brands Samsung and sony rate very high.  If you purchase a kodak, I have 2 words for you --Good luck.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: BrattamerPT
Reviews.Content: This is my third Kodak.  It did not disappoint me.  It takes excellent pictures and is easy to use.  Love the image stabilization, so I get great pics even when using the zoom without a tripod. I have taken over 350 pictures so far on the battery it came with and it is still going strong. I do think it is pretty cheap of Kodak to not include a rechargeable battery, which means I had to buy one separately.  Otherwise, the only con I have found is the lens cap falls off very easily.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: William Mcmurray
Reviews.Content: i have had this camera about two months and taken 1000+ pics.this is the best camera i have owned in a long time, since digital.  the IS is great for low light.  fast saves and button to shutter speed.i did add a rechargable battery and basic doc.

Reviews.Title: On/Off Switch Doesn't Work
Reviews.Author: Patty "K"
Reviews.Content: I've been looking forward to experimenting with photography with this camera and received it for Christmas yesterday.  After taking a few pictures, it shut off.  The battery that it came with was bad, so I put new lithium batteries in it and it would only turn on if I put the dial on "sports mode". I took a couple of pictures before it shut off again.  The on/off switch is odd.  It stays in the "On" position regardless of whether it's on or not.  When I move the switch, it turns on and immediately back off.  I'll be taking it back.  Does anyone have any recommendations for a higher pixel camera with high zoom?

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare Z1012 10.1MP Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom
Reviews.Author: Martha L. Toner
Reviews.Content: I am highly excited about this camera.  It is all I have asked for and more for a camera at this price.  I am an artist, so I need a camera that will show me detail in my pictures.  I am thrilled that I can take pictures of birds flying and then zoom them in on my computer to see the detail without the image distorting.  I recommend this camera for anyone who is on a budget and needs a camera with clarity.  I like the lasting battery.  I had to order the battery charger and extra batteries so I can take 600 - 700 pictures in a short amount time. A Fantastic Camera.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera for a great price
Reviews.Author: Apil Tamang "apil"
Reviews.Content: The autofocus is sometimes a little tardy, but give enough time and it'll do a magnificent job. Or, just goto manual mode and use the appropriate settings to take instant shots.Image stabilization is not very good, and some high zoom pictures of mine have come a bit fuzzy. However I am willing to attribute that more to my own shortcoming than the camera itself. I'm sure using a tripod and auto-timer shot will eliminate that fuzziness (which I haven't tried until now!).For the price, it is a good camera for starting amateur photographers. Strongly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Has the feel of a traditional camera
Reviews.Author: R. Hobbs
Reviews.Content: I love the camera. It feels like a tradition camera and can be set to operate like one if you wish. The photos are excellent. The batteries which came with it are worthless. Had to order a lithium ion batteries with a charger, an extra $45. The software is a little hard to navigate but does all you need it to. A friend of mine has a docking station and prints excellent quality photos.

Reviews.Title: using the Kodak Z1012IS
Reviews.Author: R. Bailey "picture me"
Reviews.Content: I have had the camera for about a month now and very happy with the purchase. I read many reviews and have the following comments.I use KLIC-8000-1800 rechargable batteries and carry 3. I typically use 1 battery in about a 3-4 hour period with the camera on and taking about 150 pictures during that time. You can not expect much more. I use only the electronic view finder and have the image stabilization always active. I use the automatic and manual modes. I have taken photos using the 12x opitical zoom with 5x digital zoom, 60x equivalent, without a tripod. The images were in focus and produce very good 8x10s. Croping and enlarging not recommended because of loss of resolution at 60x. 12x zoom is excellent. Camera does well at low light but requires more operator ability. The HD movie with stereo sound is nice. I use only fixed focus. Sound level is a little low for my taste but can be corrected using external software. The camera can only except 4gb SDHC memory. Any more will cause problems. If you need more, buy extra. I have much to learn. The extened manual from Kodak is better than the short pocket version. Alot of fun expermentation is required.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera! Great Photos! Easy To Use!
Reviews.Author: Kim G. "Kim G."
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! Excuse my lack of professional camera terms but I will try to explain the camera performance in a day-to-day functional way. My main reason for purchasing this camera was the information that stated the camera took good quality photos with quick shutter speed. I am pleased with the shutter speed, especially since I shut off the picture review which seemed to allow for faster consecutive picture taking. My kids are young and active and before I purchased this camera I felt like I was missing some great shots because my previous cameras had slower shutter speeds. The shutter speed is certainly not as fast as a professional camera however it works great for my needs. I mainly use the automatic settings which have produced great photos so far. The camera is pretty light weight and easy to carry with you if you don't mind a camera that won't fit in your pocket. The videos I have taken with the camera have come out well, the sound is audible and clear. I have only two compliants. The first is that the camera will occassionaly "freeze" and I have to open the battery cover to get the camera to respond again. My second complaint is that it is hard to get the rechargable battery out of the camera, there is no "eject" button like my previous cameras have had. I have to pinch and pull to get the battery out. For all of the things that I love about this camera, my two complaints are pretty minor. I purchased the KLIC-8000 rechargable batteries and charger and have had good success with them: long life, quick charging. Overall, I would certainly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic for the Beginning Photographer!
Reviews.Author: A. DeLucenay
Reviews.Content: This camera is definitely a fantastic buy for anybody who is wanting to learn more about photography but still have the comforts of the automatic settings.  After recently taking this camera on a day trip to a state park (Letchworth in NY), it proved to have a fine battery life with the Kodak recharables (over 100 pictures over the course of 8 or so hours) and had excellent pictures!  The one feature I found most impressive was how well the stitching went for the panoramic shots.  They certainly turned out beautiful!  The automatic "smart mode" really helps you to capture some beautiful moments, and the automatic touch-up performed really helps you gauge your pictures.  The color was amazing, and the ease of use was really nice.  The software, which I've grown accustomed to, is quite easy and useful to transfer your pictures and charge the camera if you have the dock.  Definitely a great camera!

Reviews.Title: Unbelievably Good
Reviews.Author: J. Harrison
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera with lots of neat features built in. It's nice that picture taking can be as simple or as complicated as you want it to be. It's light-weight and small, but not too small. It has a good size LCD screen but if you happen to be at the beach, (like with my last camera) and can't see the screen because it's too bright, there is also a digital view finder that you can look through so you can actually see what you're taking a picture of. The 12x zoom, panarama stitch, time delay shutter, burst pictures, image stabilization, the optional manual selections for focus-speed-aperture and flash, all make this camera a huge step up from other cameras in its class. Beginners can easily take a perfect(and fast) shot with totally automatic settings as well. Beach Camera had the best price I've seen for this camera. Delivery was in 5 business days.

Reviews.Title: Popup flash stops popping up
Reviews.Author: Arvind C "AC"
Reviews.Content: The popup flash is a big issue with camera like this. The popup flash stopped popping up for my camera and the camera is basically useless. The camera also shuts down every once in a while for no reason and I miss precious shots. I loved the camera initially because of all the features it has but now I hate it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Janell Penha "Jay. Pen"
Reviews.Content: I enjoy photography as a hobby. When I went on a trip to the Caribbean Islands, this camera did an awesome job of capturing that picture that I wanted it to capture; whether I was being transported on a bumpy road or on water.  It also did an amazing job with video! This is a HIGHLY recommended camera! Also shipping was good!!

Reviews.Title: The Choice Was Easy
Reviews.Author: Duane Hatton "Big Belter"
Reviews.Content: I planned to buy a camera LIKE this one but didn't want to get a KODAK....don't ask me why. So, I got the one almost just like it by another maker...and another maker, both costing a bit more than the Kodak and with a few less features to boot. Well a family member bought Kodak and let me fiddle with it for the day. Wow! it was so expensive feeling in my hand, unlike the other two, it has features galore and takes the warmest photos I've ever seen except for my Canon powershot.Kodak really raised the bar here. Simple things like a separate door for the memory, so your batteries don't fall out every time you take out the card. Terrific image stabilization! And superior video ...that looked like 720p!Don't waster your time like I did. Get this camera. By the way, it only uses two batteries instead of four and the display is so clean, you'll love it.

Reviews.Title: It's pretty good!
Reviews.Author: M.N. "maddie"
Reviews.Content: I just received this camera about a week ago, so I haven't gotten a chance to totaly mess around with all of the cameras functions. The picture quality is great, but I have noticed that when I upload my photos onto my pc, on some photos the corners are dark. I'm wondering if anyone else has had the same issue with it. Utherwise I really like the camera.

Reviews.Title: The Best Point & Shoot Super Zoom out there!
Reviews.Author: gabazero
Reviews.Content: Pros:Very good image quality. Short next-shot & 1st-shot delay. Dynamic range, ISO with best quality of 800. Versatile manual control & manual focus & can zoom optically when recording video. Easy to useCons:AA lithium battery only last a day,The lens capReview:Produces images with excellent sharpness, although I did notice some slight noise. Sony cyber shot DSC-H10 can't match the performance of this camera, & most of all the Price. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Rosemary Paradis
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera a few weeks ago to upgrade from my last easy share. The pictures are great, and you can capture shots real fast and clear. I even had the chance to use the panoramic on it and it turned out great! I have had so many people ask where I got it and how much did I pay. I will definately stick with this one for a while.

Reviews.Title: Enhanced click-to-capture speed (0.14 sec)
Reviews.Author: Logical
Reviews.Content: The Enhanced click-to-capture speed (0.14 sec)is what first attracted to this camera.Very easy to use and intuitive.Will update later.

Reviews.Title: there must be bad ones loose
Reviews.Author: William J. Taggart
Reviews.Content: Lots of good reviews here, Consumers Reports, too.  However, either no one thinks this is important, or there are some really poorly focusing examples of this camera out in the wild.  I got this Kodak 2 weeks ago, and noticed immediately that it seemed to have trouble focusing.  It seems constantly to be working on it.  An image almost is brought into focus, then it goes out, and stays there.  My first and last adventure with this camera was a wedding.  I took many available light photos, that were clearly viewable in the viewfinder.  Roughly half of them were out of focus, or the focus was on a part of the image that wasn't in "the box".  This camera replaced a 7 year old Olympus Camedia that died.  The Camedia never had this problem with focus.  Reviews discussing shutter lag indicate it is due to focusing taking place after the shutter is pressed.  In that event, with the lag being described as under two-tenths of a second, it would seem that focusing should be very quick, very accurate.  Not in the example camera I had.  One other Amazon review mentions focus issues similar to mine.  No one else.  I've returned mine (to Target), and I'm afraid to get another.  I'll keep looking.

Reviews.Title: awesome camera
Reviews.Author: K. Sirmans
Reviews.Content: great camera from Kodak! this is my second digital camera and it is a good camera, very easy to use. Definately recommend this one to anyone looking for a quality camera that is easy to use and takes great pictures. It also takes good video with good sound.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: Laurel Sutton
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for the price and the pictures are extremely clear. The Z1012 is my third Kodak camera and I have had nothing but great luck with them. Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: superb
Reviews.Author: Juan R. Santamaria "MATU"
Reviews.Content: fOR THE PRICE I THINK THIS CAMERA IS SUPERB. IT HAS 10MP AND 12 OP.ZOOM ! AND IT IS EASY TO USE.

Reviews.Title: Fabulous digital camera
Reviews.Author: Christopher J. Kopf
Reviews.Content: This camera does everything well.  The 10.1 MP resolution is superb.  The weight and grip work well for one handed use.  It came with two rechargable batteries and a plug in charger.  Transfer to computer is easy via USB.  Manual operation is great in certain situations but full auto does just fine.  Lots of settings to fine tune operation but default settings will work for most.

Reviews.Title: Great for everything EXCEPT..
Reviews.Author: Romanza
Reviews.Content: You really can't beat this camera for almost all applications. Definitely 4 of 5 stars. Its a fantastic still camera, will give you photo lab quality prints. The video feature is great & Kodak fixed the irritating noise problem while shooting video and zooming, this model does not have the problem of hearing a loud zoom during playback.There is one thing though that really annoys me about Kodak and that's their persistent design of only allowing recorded video in .MOV format which is QuickTime.  This makes me seriously consider not getting a Kodak next time because I am a Windows user. I have owned several Kodak digicams & they all export only to .MOV including their newer models like the Ki8.  Now this is a dream come true for Apple fans, but for the rest of the PC world its a bloody nightmare and here's why:  ....MOV files, while fantastic quality, are not easily converted to a Windows format. they need to be converted to use Windows Movie Maker, and also if you want to burn a viewable DVD!  All of the other so-called movie making programs for Windows just don't work as well as Windows Movie Maker.  Windows has various DVD creating programs, some are aftermarket, but almost all don't recognize .MOV so you have to convert the files to .AVI or .WMV (Windows Media for burning DVDs to be watched in any DVD player).Workaround: There are several freeware programs out there that do a good conversion to Windows formats. one that seems to work is Prism Video converter & last I checked there was a free version. But its still time consuming and awkward to convert & keep track of all the diff't formats once you save them to your hardrive. Allegedly there is always a quality degradation when converting but I've found if you do it right & play around with the settings, the Windows files work well, and .wmv is a smaller file size than .avi .  you can then use the .wmv files for movie maker and making DVDs. NOTE: It is NOT NECESSARY to convert the .MOV files if you are not going to edit them, & plan on uploading them raw to YouTube because you can still view the .MOV files in Windows with the use of the free QuickTime player.Only other gripe video audio quality for speech is not that good, 2 of 5 stars here. Its going to be fine in most situations but if you're doing product demos or interviews for YouTube, there's better cameras out there for audio. The bad part about this is Kodak's EARLIER cameras that didn't shoot HD had BETTER audio. That was a shock when I first got this model which was more money. Also the battery life is moderately weak, get a good rechargeable battery on Amazon so you have a backup at all times & you'll be set for any situation.By the way, you don't need to software, its a computer resource hog and your computer (XP or later) will recognize & offload the files just fine on its own.other than these gripes, the camera is a winner and functions great in all other applications, and is extremely easy to use.  The huge glass Schneider lens is a plus, too.Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: Good "middle ground" solution for family pictures--video--home budget
Reviews.Author: Craig Arno "Gadget Connoisseur"
Reviews.Content: UPDATE 3-May-2012: Found MOV to AVI conversion software solution, described below in "cons" section.The Z1012 IS camera solves 80+% of my indoor and outdoor family video and picture taking needs.  I also use it for documenting some of my electronic designs.I purchased this camera two years ago to replace my camera bag full of clunky palm sized SVHS Stereo video camera and pocket point-n-shoot with all needed accessories.  What attracted me was the promise of good pictures, use of standard SDHC memory cards (I use 16GB and 32GB SDHC cards) and can use standard AA batteries (not quite true).Pros: - Wide "Optical" telephoto range for really close and zooming way in on distant objects. - This camera does a reasonably good job of creating 720p Stereo movies (1280x720 .MOV files), better than my SVHS unit. - Sufficient replacement for a general purpose pocket point-and-shoot with 10.1Megapixel images.  If you are happy with point and shoot, you'll probably like this camera. - I get about a 1 hour of HD720p stereo recording with one 16GB-SDHC card.  A few spares in your pocket with a second DLK800 battery should last for a -lot- of shooting. UPDATE: 32GB SDHC cards also work in this camera. - Length of video shooting is determined by the size of the memory card (use Class 6 speed SDHC) - Fairly wide light level range for indoor/dark pictures without flash. - Flash with red-eye and standard flash settings for still photos. - Runs for a long time on a fully charged Lenmar DLK8000 Digital Camera Equivalent to the Kodak KLIC-8000 Battery with Maximal Power FC600 CAN NB-6L Rapid Travel Charger for Canon Battery (Silver) (two more things to keep track of, but needed for this camera, and inexpensive) - I usually need two fully charged Lenmar DLK8000 Digital Camera Equivalent to the Kodak KLIC-8000 Battery batteries for a day of intensive shooting (400+ pictures and 20-30 minutes of video). - Great price to ensure that one time events with my kids are captured with HD video, stereo sound, and 10Megapixel images, before they are all grown up and picture taking opportunities gone. - This camera is so automated that my 10 year old can take good point and shoot pictures, which is about 80%-90% of our picture/video needs.Cons: - As other reviewers have noted, if you do more than point and shoot and expect easy/quick control over F-stop, shutter timing, and focus foreground/background, you need a real digital SLR, which this product isn't. - 2xAA battery power can be done in an emergency, but the camera will claim batteries are dead in about 5 minutes, which they aren't.  Insufficient internal power supply design.  Use the Lithium Ion battery mentioned above for real world use of this product. - I have enough camera shooting skills that at times I fight the camera automation for color balance, foreground/background focus, shutter speed, things that are fairly straightforward with an SLR. - The .MOV files use an audio format that isn't playable on products like Western Digital WDTV Full HD Media Player - Recertified (Video plays fine, just no sound even though it's there)UPDATE 3-May-2012: MP4Cam2AVI Free Video Conversion software (to convert this camera's MOV files to AVI)[...]MP4Cam2AVI software converts (has batch mode) the Z1012 IS .mov files to .avi.  The problem solved is many media players can't handle the PWM audio track encoded by the camera.  This Open Software project by default doesn't convert the video (lossless process), just the problematic stereo audio track.  The result is an AVI file which plays perfectly on my WD-Live player to my TV.In general, even with the limitations listed above, I'm generally happy with this purchase at the relatively low price listed.

Reviews.Title: I like taking pictures
Reviews.Author: Charles E. Newman
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in February 2009.  I really like it for the quality of the pictures.  I usually keep it in automatic mode because it seems to work the best when in this mode.  It's been to Europe and Asia with me and I have some excellent photos.The one complaint I have about being in auto is that the camera does not always flash when needed or wanted.  It shows you an indicator on the LCD screen while you are framing up the photo if the flach is going to come on or not.  A icon of a candle means no way!  Now you can fool the camera buy tilting it or moving around until the candle icon goes away, then click.  This usually only happens in dimly lit situations that would be like being in candle light.  You can however take it out of auto and change it to aperture control.  The flash works and the quality of the picture is very close to auto mode.  It's just a pain to snap 6 indoor shots and the number 7 has no flash because auto determined not to turn on the flash.I used the video portion and it plays back great on the camera, but I did not have the same success once I downloaded it to my computer.  It was choppy.The software works great for downloading and storing your photos.  It even lets you upload to the internet and invite anyone to see them.  It was free when I was doing it, I don't know if there is a charge now.I use the rechargeable batteries and at least an 8 MB SD card.  Even in the 10MP mode, it can store thousands of pictures.I used the burst mode to take a tiger jumping through a ring of fire from at least 100 yards away.  It wasn't the greatest photo series, but it was better than I expected from that distance and zooming in.  I would say it looked like the best pictures you would get out of a disposable camera for comparison.If it wasn't for the hiccup with the candle light icon in auto, I would but this camera again.  Most people when they see the pictures assume I have a very high end camera.  I do have to agree, it has excellent picture quality.

Reviews.Title: very good picture quality
Reviews.Author: T. R. Baker
Reviews.Content: This camera takes very good pictures for the price range that it fits in.  Very seldom do we have pictures out of focus, very crisp pictures probably 95% of the time.  I own a few other cameras in this style/price range and this is the best of them.  It is very user friendly, flash pops up when it senses that it needs it (could be a negative if you are taking pictures of wildlife).  Zoom is powerful and accurate.  I have had other Kodaks that were average, this one is very nice.  Battery life is average, not very good.

Reviews.Title: Takes good pictures when the battery is not dead
Reviews.Author: Kathryn Mullen "girlzillla"
Reviews.Content: The camera takes good pictures and videos.  It has a great zoom.  Buy lots of extra batteries and a charger.  Something in this camera drains the batteries.  I can put a brand new, out of the package battery in the camera and not turn the camera on and go to use the camera one day later and the battery is dead.  We now keep the battery out of the camera until we want to take a picture.  I contacted Kodak about the problem and no resolution.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera for the money
Reviews.Author: soccer dad
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera refurb. from an Amazon seller and it works great.  The lens is flexible and pretty good.  I'm an old school 35mm SLR guy and I've always been disappointed with the shutter lag and lack of control in point and shoot digicams.  This camera is quick like my old SLR and has enough controls to make picture taking fun again.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Z1012 IS 12x Optical Zoom Malfunction
Reviews.Author: Diana
Reviews.Content: We purchased the Kodak Z1012 12x Optical Zoom at the end of last year. Besides eating batteries, the very sensitive zoom cannot quite figure it out at times. But more importantly the past two weeks the zoom has been malfunctioning, and on numerous occasions the camera has difficulty closing. It simply freezes. Then this morning I downloaded my garden photos from yesterday, and there were only 2! What happened to the rest of them, including our dinner photos with friends? No bargain for a 9-month old cameraKodak EasyShare Z1012 10.1MP Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom.

Reviews.Title: good camera w/ amazing zoom & takes gorgeous night pics!
Reviews.Author: Hope this helps...
Reviews.Content: I don't have this model, I have the older model for a year & a half.  PROS: this series of Kodak cameras takes great day pics, beautiful night pics (provided you have a tripod), the 12X optical zoom is amazing! it's not pocketable but still small & lightweight for a camera w/ such features. CONS: the processing time between shots is longer than I've experienced w/ other point & shoot cameras & the macro mode does not work well - the camera is unable to focus on close range for photography of small flowers.  also -after taking 3000+ shots w/ the camera, it's starting to show some signs of mal-function: like the review mode jumping to the camera mode frequently on its own during the photo review function, & the camera freezing up on rare occasions which required me to take the battery out to restart it.  but it probably will still last me another year or few.despite the cons, I still love this camera for its versatility & super zoom function!  & the price is great.  I will definitely buy this camera again when mines die.

Reviews.Title: When it works, it's great!
Reviews.Author: Susan "Susan"
Reviews.Content: I received this camera in December 2008.  After using it for a few weeks, I noticed that it would periodically shut off for no reason, immediately after I turned it on.  I assumed the batteries were weak and replaced them and that sometimes helped but sometimes it didn't.  Then I did an internet search on "problems with the Kodak Z1012" and realized that several people were having the same issue with this camera.  The camera takes great pictures but it does have problems with shutting itself down, even with brand new batteries of any kind.  It isn't reliable but it does take good pictures when it works.

Reviews.Title: After 1 month, can't transfer pictures anymore. 1 month + 1 week: Works again, 3 Stars, not 1 Star
Reviews.Author: Dharma's Cat
Reviews.Content: I just had this camera for 1 month, when I suddenly could no longer transfer pictures from the camera to the computer. I consulted the manual, followed self-help instructions on Kodak's web site, and did an on-line chat. The information I got contradicts each other, and nothing solved the problem, at least so far.You're supposed to connect the USB cable, turn on the camera, and then the software comes up automatically. Well, suddenly nothing happened anymore. I consulted the "extended manual" for trouble shooting tips, to no avail. Then I went through the step-by-step self help instructions on the Kodak support site. Well, I did it twice, but each time at the end it asked me to check for a green blinking light, and because there wasn't one, supposedly the camera was broken and I should send it in for repair. Except: There never was such a green blinking light. OK, so that didn't make sense. Then I used the online chat. The technician finally instructed me to buy a "U-8 USB cable", which I did. He really didn't make much sense to me (first he told me that my USB port on my computer was broken. when I objected that other devices work just fine, and that I tried all three ports, then he said "you need a U-8 cable". well, what do you mean? that I don't have one, or that the one I have is broken. "you need a U-8 USB cable). Sceptically, I bought one. Well, it just arrived - and it still doesn't work.So after 1 month, I now have a useless camera. I'll have to contact support again, and probably send it in for repair. Not great at all, but the worthless support is just not acceptable. I don't expect that self-help steps or FAQs be able to solve every problem, but they mustn't give *incorrect* information. And an online "technician" should not what he / she is talking about.Update: Used online chat again. This time, I got someone who actually knew what he was talking about. Fixing the problem involved a lot of wizardry on my computer (removing and reactivating certain devices and stuff). And it works again!By the way, I do love the camera otherwise. Just keeping my finger crossed that I either don't run into problems again, or if I do, that I luck out and get someone who knows their stuff.I apparently cannot change / update my rating, so it'll stay at one star.Update: Now I was able to change it to 3 starts.Another update: I bumped it against a table in a restaurant. Really not very violently in my view. Well, it continues to work - except I can't transfer data from the camera to the computer anymore, i.e. it's actually useless. Repair would have cost about $100 (if I remember correctly), so instead I decided to buy a new one). I think a camera should be *a little* more robust than this. Well, it is what it is. It was very good when it worked, but didn't do so often enough or long enough.

Reviews.Title: SLR Quality in a point & shoot
Reviews.Author: D. Schillinger
Reviews.Content: The Kodak Z1012 is the best camera I've ever owned, and I've had a bunch (including 3 digitals).It does almost everything an SLR camera will do, but also has all the convenience of a point-and-shoot. Want to use macro-focus for a close-up of a flower? Can do. Manual exposure? Sure. Manual Focus? Yes.But if you don't want to fuss with all that, you can set it to automatic and let the camera do the work.It takes great pictures: terrific color, fabulous detail.I love having a bigger LCD Screen, but I also love having the option to turn it off (Saving battery) and using the eyepiece viewfinder. This also helps in bright outdoors conditions where the screen is hard to see.The best feature is the extra-long zoom lens.  Great for getting pictures of your kid's stupid talent show from the back of the auditorium!Worst feature: the video clip function.  Although it claims these are HD clips, they're not any better than the low-quality video clips you can shoot with any digital camera.  And they shoot in the worst video format: .mov files.  They only play with Apple's Quicktime unless you take an hour to convert them.  Posting a 30-second video clip to Facebook, etc takes almost an hour.The Kodak Software is very clunky and not user-friendly. So I don't use it. But that's not a big drawback. You can use any software you like.As for it being a battery hog, there are several settings you can turn on or off that have a huge impact on battery life.  You can turn off the LCD screen (Or turn down the brightness), you can set it so the stabilizer is not constantly adjusting the lens, etc.  My rechargeable Lithium Ion batteries last up to 2 weeks.This is a great camera for people who want the best of both worlds: point-and-shoot AND SLR-type function.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: S. Soman "S"
Reviews.Content: What a great camera.  Not only are the pictures great, I can take high quality indoor shots often without using the flash.  Natural-light shots are often far better than those taken with a flash due to the absence of harsh shadows created by flash units.  The videos are of high quality.The 12X zoom can be used while shooting videos which is something earlier models could not do.  Only caveat.  Make sure you use the proper rechargeable batteries.  Otherwise, use the AA lithium available everywhere.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: Cynthia E. Wilson
Reviews.Content: This camera was a great investment, it came early and looked great. I will buy from you again.  Thanks!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: cjs
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this camera!  It takes crystal-clear pictures. Once I learned to switch to EVF mode (the EVF/LCD button), I could take great action shots too.  The EasyShare software is, as the name suggests, easy to use.  You can edit and enhance the photos.  I would bought some Lenmar rechargeable batteries (cheaper than name-brand), and the battery life is very good.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easy Share Camera
Reviews.Author: Carol A. Purkey
Reviews.Content: Both my husband and I are thrilled with our new camera!  It is easy to use and takes beautiful, clear pictures.  We did need to go out and buy a memory stick shortly after getting it as the original memory only holds about 10 photographs.  The battery is also short-lived.  A lithium battery is just such an expensive proposition, so we bought rechargeable ones and it works just fine now.  I love the way it can be hooked up to my computer and the ease with which photos can be shared as part of the software in the original package.  A GREAT deal for the money!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: vardangor
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this camera. Bright color, excellent performance in low light, powerful zoom. The lens is great. The camera is easy to use, just leaving it automatic mode yields great results, although there are a large number of manual settings available to you. It captures great outdoor detail yet can also provide close-up detail in a dark theatre. A surprising feature is the high quality HD video (720p), although as expected, recording video in HD creates huge files. I've been pleased with the video recorded in 480. The camera has a high-quality feel to it. Compared to a compact camera, this Z1012 uses more battery power and may not fit in a shirt pocket, but its performance is far superior.

Reviews.Title: A Really Great Family Camera
Reviews.Author: S. Weber "Camera Instructor"
Reviews.Content: I have owned my Kodak Z-1012 for 8 months now and it has been a super camera. I have not had a single problem with the camera. With care, it is capable of just about any kind of photo.As a professioal digital camera instructor, I readily recommend the Z-1012 to my students, because of all it can do. When [...] had their sale I purchased two more Z-1012 cameras. They will go to our two married daughters who are active Moms, who along with their great husbands are raising families. Part of active families, is recording the memories, and this camera, the Z-1012 is a perfect family camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera - Eats Batteries
Reviews.Author: Dillon Joseph Shearer
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is very good.  Auto focus does great on still objects, but is a little slow on randomly moving objects.Video feature is top notchBatteries have not lasted long at all.  I have ordered the Kodak rechargable battery suggested.

Reviews.Title: Great camera with an excellent zoom ability!
Reviews.Author: N. Andreacci
Reviews.Content: I have been using this camera for over a year.  It's great to capture action during sporting events, even soccer from the sidelines across a big field.  The strong optical zoom is great.  The pictures it takes are crystal clear, sharp, and have true colors.  The panorama option is incredible.  It stitches three photos together seamlessly.  Con's:  The on/off slider switch is poorly designed. The battery does not recharge in the camera.

Reviews.Title: fantastic bargain!
Reviews.Author: Mia
Reviews.Content: I found this camera on sale at Target (in store, Oct. 2008) for $99 and decided to take a chance. At that price, it can't hurt! And it has been performing like a champ. The video is great, I'm getting lots of great photos -- all without knowing too much about cameras. I'm a point-and-shoot photographer and this camera has definitely improved my game while not requiring me to make a true study of photography.My only 'negative' comments are things that don't bother me, but might bother others: there is a noise associated with the zoom, even when using the "museum" setting, so factor that in if you're trying to be discreet. The auto focus on the video works great, but in low light, it is constantly refocusing so your videos may have a slight blur here and there. Again, for my purposes, I don't care about that stuff. A GOOD thing about the video is that the mic works really well and the sound is nicely balanced (videos of a live band in a small bar turned out great, where my previous camera would have sounded a little muffled) and you can use the zoom while recording [I think it says in the manual that you can't, but mine does].I'm really happy with it. The external battery charger is almost required. When I recharge using the USB cable, it never seems to charge fully or last very long. But that is also expected (based on my past cameras). This is my first Kodak in a decade and I'm really happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Nice bridge camera
Reviews.Author: Manny Casanova
Reviews.Content: This is my second Kodak camera in the last six months (the previous one was a V803). Since a real DSLR is out of my budget at the moment I got this one as a transition step. Most of my experience has been from point a shot cameras so this is my first encounter with PASM modes. To be fair, the camera performs as expected. I do not like smart modes since they get the "Perfect Touch" automaticaly applied and also tends to select higher ISO values wich results in a bit noisy pictures. In the positive side, smart capture mode has a function to track your subject once it gets focused that is realy nice and handy. Scene modes are more than enough for casual, family and landscape photos. If you are looking for an affordable way to get yourself into the aperture/shutter speed concerns  then this camera is a sure bet for learning it without losing the point and shot simplicity. What I really miss in this camera is the ability to save photos in raw format (Z1015 IS does it already, although I don't know how good it's at it), KODAK should consider to offer that functionality to Z1012 owners (even it they charge them for that I'd take it).  Picture quality is very good, especialy in well lit conditions. I don't give it a five stars because of the annoying wasted time with the "proccesing" message that freeze the camera from time to time. I honest want to make clear that am not a professional so I might be not 100 percent accurate but I positively recommend this one to everyone.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding Value for novice photography
Reviews.Author: J. Lewis
Reviews.Content: I purchased this to replace a similarly equipped Fuji camera (I was unhappy with it's usability)  This is a great camera!  It's 'auto' mode is great for me, where I like point and shoot pictures and it's extended features work great for my daughter who does some near-pro work.Beautiful colors, clarity and depth that I would have expected to find in an dSLR costing much more.  For someone not looking to go quite as far as an SLR, I would highly recommend this!

Reviews.Title: YOU'RE GONNA' LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: Ru "Ru"
Reviews.Content: This camera is easy to use, and the pics are great.  I use it to photo my original artwork to send off for prints.  The color density and sharpness is noticably improved from my older Easyshare.I am very happy to report Kodak is improving all the time.  That's a good thing!

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: PAUL STONE "AMAZON JON"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this Kodak Z1012 to replace our older, and no longer in production, Kodak P880 with great concerns that it wouldn't measure up. We've had the camera for several weeks now and absolutely love it! It has by far surpassed all of our expectations and we recommend that you ignore any negative reviews that you may read if you you are an average family (rather than a nit-picky professional focusing on insignificant details) looking for great quality pictures capturing everyday Kodak moments.

Reviews.Title: Takes Great Pictures
Reviews.Author: Reefsbum
Reviews.Content: This camera replaces my Kodak Z612. I expected similar performance but with higher megapixels and better zoom. I got that and more. Thanks to updated technology many more photos come out just as expected, with little or no editing required. The camera is big but very comfortable in the hand. I'm happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Camera has issues. Avoid
Reviews.Author: Quentin Westcott
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera a year ago and for the last 6 months it's given me nothing but problems.The camera constantly thinks that the battery is low.  You can put in fresh batteries and in a few sessions, it thinks they're wearing out.  The batteries work fine in all other electrical products. There is no telling how long the camera will stay on, sometimes shuts off in a manner of seconds.Several family members have the same camera and have reported similar problems, but it took those longer to surface. Because these problems (all or ours) pop up months after we purchased the item, there's no taking it back, and we're stuck with buggy cameras.In my opinion: don't purchase.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Z1012 10.1 MP -- Love It
Reviews.Author: William W. Laveck "wwlaveck"
Reviews.Content: I have not had much time to learn all of the features, but I am very happy with my purchase. Being an X 35mm hobbyist, I enjoy having different options of control, from fully automatic to fully manual. It does eat up batteries, I am soon going to purchase some rechargeable. That brings me to another feature, the camera can use AA, rechargeable AA's, CRV3 and CRV3 rechargeable.

Reviews.Title: Wifes Digital
Reviews.Author: Capt Larry Rocho "Old Gringo"
Reviews.Content: Wife uses this camerea constantly. Have had no problems with it. Do recommend purchase of extra batteries as power usage is considerable.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera Alright...This is my second one
Reviews.Author: Perche
Reviews.Content: This simple camera takes clear pictures of the moon if you are out of the city.  Daytime shots anywhere are gorgeous.  I miss Kodak!

Reviews.Title: Not what was advertised
Reviews.Author: BTDT549
Reviews.Content: Was not like new. Shipping it back was $17 so bought new battery and charger for $15. After that I thought it was ok until I needed to use the flash, doesn't work, but by that time it was too late to send back. I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS SELLER.

Reviews.Title: Non working camera
Reviews.Author: rudolf snoeker
Reviews.Content: The camera contained empty batteries and no disk.After replacing the batteries with complete new ones and inserting a new disk, I tested the camera.After 1 photo the message was that the batteries were empty.I inserted completely new fully loaded batteries.It was looked like the camera was making the pictures, but  only a party of them were stored.After that is was no more possible to make pictures and the message was that the batteries were empty.As I bought the camera with the highest rating, I was verry disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Kodak 1012iS
Reviews.Author: Scott Mortier
Reviews.Content: These little 'pocket' Kodak Cameras are amazingly fun and easy to use in almost any condition. The only complaints would include a click to capture speed issue (still have this issue with even the better Bridge Cameras today) and the fact that the little SD card door on the bottom tends to detach itself from the camera and get lost!

Reviews.Title: Loved my camera
Reviews.Author: Dr. T
Reviews.Content: Loved this camera. Panorama, scene selections and tons of setting. Even if you decide not to use the settings, leaving the setting on the default "camera" logo will get you great pictures any day. This camera takes great photos even in complete darkness, just set the flash on...and that is it.I loved the camera since I bought it in 2008, and I still love it.I have also recorded several video clips with this baby. Battery usage is also good. I bought an extra Kodak Li-Ion battery just to make sure there is a backup battery if needed.My 4 years old took great photos with this camera.The zoom is really a zooooooommmmmmmm. Fantastic!

Reviews.Title: Kodak Purchase
Reviews.Author: Clifford Isaac
Reviews.Content: Happy with this camera. I would recommend a Kodak. Sorry they went out of business. Great camera.  Will buy again

Reviews.Title: Great, But..
Reviews.Author: Trevor
Reviews.Content: overall best camera ive ever had but the only bad thing is its not a dslr so u cant put a rokinon fisheye on it but u can put an add on adapter to put other lenses on it intead of putting 1 little ring on the lens and put another on top of that.

Reviews.Title: Desent camera..
Reviews.Author: DJ
Reviews.Content: The lens has a wonderful zoom of 12x optical, but the lens is slow to respond to zoom commands . other things; stick with a SD card no bigger than 4gs , if you go higher then 4gs the camera will slow dramatically and your pics will take a little time to be transfer to the card . The battery of the camera is a little disappointing it run out of juice after 45 pics . Besides those little flats ,the Kodak Easyshare Z1012 camera take good quality pictures great features ( Color modes my favorite ) this camera is perfect for beginners or moderated camera users,but for professionals or demanding  users look some place else. if only  they can make a camera with a descent battery life, add on adapters(macro,wide angle lenses )Kodak would have a killer camera! they have the tools to do it !

Reviews.Title: Date battery not serviceable
Reviews.Author: Rick
Reviews.Content: I purchased 2 of these cameras 1 for my son and 1 for my wife just 2 years ago. Within weeks of each other they both started prompting for the time and date. After some research I find that the date battery is not servicable and the only way to repair it is to send the camera in for $80 per camera!!###&&&((@!I was not happy to find this out and contacted Kodak and they are basically saying TOO BAD TO BE YOU...... Customer support is TERRIBLE.I have owned Kodak cameras in the past and have always liked thier products but these 2 cameras will be the LAST Kodak products I will ever own.........EVER!

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: angie
Reviews.Content: This camera is excelent, very easy to use, the quality of the photos are good, and it has great video quality..I recommend this camera , you will enjoy with it..(The reviewer was compensated for posting this review. However, the opinion stated in the review is that of the reviewer and the reviewer alone. Further, the reviewer independently selected this product to review and has no affiliation with the product maker/distributor, Amazon or the review requester.)

Reviews.Title: Wonderfully Simple
Reviews.Author: PurpleButterfly
Reviews.Content: i owned this camera for 2years and it never once failed to give me beautiful professional like shots,it is as close to slr camera i owned for a while,the camera is durable,simple,an perfect for any user looking to take beautiful professional like shots on a budget an for starters

Reviews.Title: Batteries
Reviews.Author: Stuart Price
Reviews.Content: This is an OK camera, but beware you will need to buy and carry a camera bag full of batteries if you use the zoom any at all.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera for the $$$
Reviews.Author: achidream
Reviews.Content: Had to buy a camera for my daughter's school class - this camera has proved to be a great camera for the best price. I would recommend this camera to anyone; it has many capabilities.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: K. Werner
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera that replaced an old Kodak EasyShare camera. The picture quality is great, and is great in low light conditions where the other camera needed a flash. If you are used to Kodak film colors, using a Kodak camera is a must.  The HD video quality is also good, although the camera doesn't seem to hold focus at times like a normal video camera. However, this is a great feature in situations where you don't always want to take a separate video camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: Mazhar Usman "Mazhar Usman"
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera with good features. Easy to use. We have covered 4-5 major events in day and night time. Excellent results came in. The only disadvantage is the battery life. You need to carry 2-3 atleast if you have a longer time period event. Overall the product is really good.

Reviews.Title: Good camera overall
Reviews.Author: LyssaLou517
Reviews.Content: In a nutshell, this is a good camera. Definitely not professional grade, but absolutely a great step up for beginners wanting to graduate from a point and shoot. I bought this camera about a year ago and I take it with me just about everywhere I go (I have a 6 year old and am always snapping away). It's fairly small, lightweight and fits easily in my pocketbook. Needless to say, this camera is one sturdy piece of equipment. It's been dropped several times and down right beat up from as much as I use it, but it's never broken and still works as well as the day I bought it.In 'smart mode' this camera takes wonderful pictues. I have received several compliments on the quality of photographs taken. On the other hand, all the manual modes are pretty worthless.. but then again, if you're experienced enough to be using the manual modes and using them on a regular basis, it almost seems worthless to have this type of camera.The only complaint I really have about this camera is it's overall speed and response time... Powering on and using the zoom lag more than I would like. Also when you use the 'burst' feature to take multiple images it takes the camera a reeeeallly long time to process the images once you're done shooting. Also be prepared to spend some bucks on batteries, as they are drained very quickly.I would absolutely reccomend this camera to anyone who is currently using a simple point and shoot, and wants to upgrade (on a budget) prior to making the leap to an SLR.

Reviews.Title: Exelentes Cámara
Reviews.Author: Daniel
Reviews.Content: Soy un aficionado dando mis primeros pasos en la fotografía y esta cámara es genial. Las fotos en los modos automáticos son muy buenas, y además te da la oportunidad de controles avanzados, talez como apertura de diafragma, tiempos de exposición de hasta 16s, control de flash, valance de color, etc. Vale la pena. Por otro lado me hubiera gustado que fuera mas grande. Y lo único que le falta, para uno que quiere jugar de profesional, es que guarde en formato RAW. Pero por lo demás, exelente compra.

Reviews.Title: Nice pictures, but goes through batteries FAST
Reviews.Author: Amy Mcfarland "Mom of 2"
Reviews.Content: This is a very easy to use camera, takes nice pictures.  I've had no technical complaints with use.  My one BIG complaint is battery life - whether I'm taking still photos or video, my camera consumes a battery inside a month.  They're ten dollars each, so this is really adding up.  I've become used to checking battery life before I leave the house to make sure I have a spare if I need it, and every once in a while it will say the battery is full, only to die 10 minutes later.  Frustrating! Apart from that, good camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera from Kodak
Reviews.Author: Marlene Amanns
Reviews.Content: This is the first digital camera I've ever purchased and I really love the quality of the pictures it takes. It is very user friendly. It has a quick shutter speed for quick pictures. I showed it to my son (he has used digital cameras) and he took to it very quickly even without reading the manual. And now he wants one. This is going to be great for taking family pictures at Christmas this year. I'm still learning about what it can do but so far I would buy it again.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: S. Strothmann
Reviews.Content: Easy to use and takes great shots! I've been able to frame a lot of the photos that I've taken with this camera and get comments on whether the photos were store bought or that I took them! Decent price too for level of camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera and fun to work with
Reviews.Author: Charity "farmcharity"
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera, I really enjoy all the features that come with it including being able to take panoramic pictures and set my camera on manual settings.

Reviews.Title: the good and the bad
Reviews.Author: jec "Jane"
Reviews.Content: I went from a Cannon SI to this.... hummmmm  When this camera functions best, you can not beat the photos you get, they are the BEST!!  However, the camera is very inconsistant.  The good....  use the view finder instead of the LCD and your battery lasts FOREVER.... recharging takes awhile so get an extra.  Mine came with the battery and charger in the box.  The zoom is incrediable and poweful.  The camera is lightweight and very easy to carry around.The not so good.  The settings, including manual can be unresponsive and agravating.  The camera likes to focus on other things, so pictures can be blury.  It always wants to flash, even in off mode.  It has a delay which can't seem to be changed so expect pictures that are blury and slightly off.  The on/off toggle is exactly the same so the camera does not always respond to you wanting it off when on or vise versa.  It also seems to get stuck processing and you must pull the battery to stop it.  Kodak would be wise to have the instruction manual more easily avaiable on line as you will need it.

Reviews.Title: KODAD EASTSHARE CAMERA REVIEW
Reviews.Author: Mrs. Rosalie M. Hoffbefrg
Reviews.Content: We are quite happy with the performance and ease of use of this camera. The pictures are sharp and the colors are accurate.

Reviews.Title: great camera,very satisfied
Reviews.Author: bookmusic
Reviews.Content: I bought a Kodak Z740 three years ago, and took almost 13000 pictures without any problem. I upgraded it to Z1012 two weeks ago, and very surprised to find the HD video of Z1012 even better than my JVC330. The picture quality of this camera is really good, clear,sharp,and the great color of Kodak camera. But don't forget buy a rechargeable Li battery for it.

Reviews.Title: Automatic setting useless, Kodak won't upgrade firmware
Reviews.Author: Tinntinabulate "Tinn"
Reviews.Content: Do not expect to be able to use this camera in automatic setting. After taking only three pictures, the camera freezes up for processing. I contacted Kodak, and they told me to stop using the automatic setting. I own a Kodak C875 which does not suffer from this defect. The Kodak Z1015IS had the same problem which Kodak provided a firmware upgrade to fix. They will not offer an upgrade for the Z1012IS.  Avoid if you do not constantly want to reset the camera for proper lighting conditions by hand.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME CAMERA!!!
Reviews.Author: C. Sprague
